麥.definition: wheat; barley; oats; mic (abbr. for 麥克風|麦克风[mai4ke4feng1])

麥克斯韋.definition: Maxwell (name); James Clerk Maxwell (1831-1879), Scottish physicist and mathematician, the originator of Maxwell's laws of electromagnetism and electromagnetic waves

麥克白.definition: Macbeth (name); Macbeth, 1606 tragedy by William Shakespeare 莎士比亞|莎士比亚

麥克米蘭.definition: McMillan or MacMillan (name); Harold Macmillan (1894-1986), UK conservative politician, prime minister 1957-1963

麥克阿瑟.definition: General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war

麥冬.definition: dwarf lilyturf (Ophiopogon japonicus), whose tuber is used in TCM

麥凱恩.definition: McCain (name); John McCain (1936-2018), US Republican politician, Senator for Arizona 1987-2018

麥寮.definition: Mailiao township in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan

麥氏賊鷗.definition: (bird species of China) South Polar skua (Stercorarius maccormicki)

麥爾維爾.definition: Melville (name); Herman Melville (1819-1891), US novelist, author of Moby Dick 白鯨|白鲸[Bai2jing1]

麥積.definition: Maiji district of Tianshui city 天水市[Tian1 shui3 shi4], Gansu

麥積區.definition: Maiji district of Tianshui city 天水市[Tian1 shui3 shi4], Gansu

麥積山石窟.definition: Mt Maiji Caves at Tianshui 天水, Gansu
